descriptionNullable:
In an online learning scenario, we have learners or students as users who enrolled in courses. In fact, to follow the standard recommender system naming convention, we call each learner a user, each course an item, and the enrollment mode or interaction as rating. So that's why we have columns named user, item, and rating instead of using learner, course, and enrollment.

Source: https://cf-courses-data.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/IBM-ML321EN-SkillsNetwork/labs/datasets/ratings.csv

## user column
- user index

## item column
- course code

## rating column
- rating = 0 (Not Enrolled)
- rating = 1 (Enrolled)
title: Course Enrollments Dataset
subtitle: Dataset for Course Recommendation System
description:

In fact, to follow the standard recommender system naming convention, we call each learner a user, each course an item, and the enrollment mode or interaction as rating. So that's why we have columns named user, item, and rating instead of using learner, course, and enrollment.
